description:
The Royal Cuckoo is a neighborhood bar and it is excellent.

I was there on a Saturday night. The bar was crowded with a good energy. I had a cocktail for $6 (September 2018 price). 

That night Lavay Smith + organ + trombone played blues. They were fantastic. No cover charge, but they asked for tips with a reasonable recommendation of $5. 

A lot of the customers talked loudly even when Lavay Smith and band were playing. I found that distracting and rude.  Oh well. 

Royal Cuckoo does not serve food but customers are welcome to bring food. I like that option! There are several restaurants nearby that one can choose for food before the Royal Cuckoo. 

Parking is street - I think it is metered, but I am not certain. 

Bart is about 8 blocks away, I think.
author: Robert H.

description:
Wow.  Just wow.
This has to be one of the most original and funkiest bars I've been to in SF.
Super chill and laid back.  60's vibe.
This is a very dark bar with red lighting and comfy furniture featuring a live band playing retro jazz.  There are various percussion instruments that are available for patrons to play if they have the skills.
Kind of reminded me of bars in David Lynch's Twin Peaks series.
Seriously fabulous.
Good whiskey selection.
Clap! Clap! Clap!
author: Thomas D.

description: Love it. Great drinks and good music. Nice patio as well.
author: Dennis A.

description:
Amazing bar with a great atmosphere! The drinks are delicious and the staff is awesome! 
Highly recommend coming when the band is playing. Super chill music and laid back vibes throughout the bar!
author: Jeffrey O.

description: This is my favorite bar in SF. Cozy, great prices, chill vibe, not too hectic. It really feels like a place people come to relax and socialize rather than party and try to hook up. Live music on a regular basis and classic vinyl besides means it's always a heart-warming refreshing time. The prices aren't too high and it still feels like an authentic part of this once wacky city.
author: Benjamin C.

description: This place is a gem. They make great cocktails, play awesome records, and if you're lucky a live organ player. They also have an awesome small outside area with lemon trees. It's a great intimate spot to have a cocktail and listen to good music. (Heads up it's cash only)
author: Michelle R.

description: Another place that has taken me years to write a review! Just a SF classic, great staff, divey enough for to enjoy, dark interiors just get your drink on and visit!
author: Reg B.

description: I think this is one of the more unique speak-easy type bars in San Francisco that I've been to. The red-tinted dark inside provides an interesting vibe that I would definitely return to. The live music was a great addition to the night, but be aware that the bar is cash only. They do have an ATM inside but I didn't use it.
author: Clayton B.

description: This bar had an awesome vibe. It's decorations were very eclectic and they had cool live music. It felt like a hipster dive bar. They had very unique cocktails that were pretty reasonably priced. The service here was also friendly and fast! Would definitely come again.
author: Courtney L.

description:
I love this bar.  I don't live in the neighborhood anymore, but was so grateful to have this one so close by when I did.  Great ambiance, awesome cocktails, cool live music, without being pretentious.  The type of place where my 63 year old dad can be a regular and I can take a date (not at the same time, of course!)  It gets pretty crowded on the weekends, but that's just a testament to the wide appeal.

Look forward to stopping by when I'm looking for a drink in the neighborhood.
author: Emma A.

description: This bar is weird. It looks like someone threw together a bunch of odds and ends from various garage sales. The bar is super dark and looks like someones attic. The whisk(e)y selection is superb. The list of bourbons,scotches,Japanese Whiskies and other esoteric brands are awe inspiring for what most would expect from a dive. The record collection which is fanfuckingtastic,really ties the vibe together. The mood in this place is always mellow,happy and relaxed thanks to all these odd puzzle pieces that have come together beautifully. I wish I lived in Bernal Heights so I come here every day after work. So what if my liver would shrivel up from sampling all their amazing whiskies. It would be worth it!
author: Zardu H.

description:
I am really kicking myself for only coming here for the first time this month.

After a day of drinking through Lower Haight and Japantown, I wanted to roll things down closer to my neighborhood. My sister suggested Royal Cuckoo and I'm glad I did.

On the border of Outer Mission and Bernal, on a block that has actually a lot of cool stuff, is Royal Cuckoo. With an interesting interior featuring low red lights, a long bar, and some cool seating.

While they have a menu for the house drinks, I wanted something with Mezcal, and the bar tender did a great job mixing me up something new and delicious. While that was going on, a two piece band featuring a guitar and the electric organ played some really neat tunes.

Beyond them was a great patio, featuring a few different areas to sit and enjoy. 

So great vibe and ambiance, a back patio, solid drink options and live music on weekend. I'm glad I came to this hidden gem.
author: Michael C.

description:
I left the Bay Area back in 1998, I'm just another tourist now.  I didn't travel here for the Royal Cuckoo itself...though it is a dark, divey but friendly bar and popular with locals.  If you're poor you can get yourself a $3 Modelo can.  If you're rich you can get yourself a $20 cocktail.  But I recommend the $9 Royal Cuckoo Gin & Tonic...a delicious fruity drink with a hint of Gin & Tonic...get it!

I really came all the way out to see Lavay Smith...my favorite SF jazz singer.  Been a fan of hers since 1996 during the 90s swing revival.  She does a weekly gig with a pianist here every Sunday night.  The full band is better, but No Cover = No Complaining. www.lavaysmith.com
author: Chun P.

description: The bar itself is really cool. Kitschy with great music but this review is strictly for the bartenders. The dudes working last night were total jerks. They act like they're doing you a favor by getting you a drink. I got 2 drinks for $16 and gave him a $20, I was planning on tipping him the $2 per drink but he didn't even give me the option to do so. He literally just never gave me the change. That's straight up rude. I've worked in the service industry for years and would NEVER not give a customer their change back. Also the other bartender literally got in a screaming fight with my friend because he felt $5 wasn't a big enough of a tip for 2 drinks because he felt they were "specialty". One was an old fashioned (which he decided to put a lime into..?) and the other was a margarita (that was brown for some reason). Honestly this place is dope but I've seen multiple complaints about the staff. They should seriously consider training them on how to interact with other people.
author: Olga Z.

description: I moved from NYC because I wanted to live in a city where there was a certain level of consideration for others. I have NEVER in the 2 years I've lived here witnessed more rude bartenders. At 1:40 they told everyone to get the F out of the bar and got aggressive when we asked if we could finish the drink we had bought 5 minutes earlier. I live around the corner and when I mentioned this to my neighbors I found that they have a reputation for this. Definitely not your friendly neighborhood joint. Would rather give my money to the million other places in the mission where they are kind human beings.
author: V M.

description:
Every time I come here, I instantly remember how much I love this bar. I'm almost afraid to write a Yelp review about it, lest the word get into the wrong hands. 

Cash only (like half of the Mission), but delectable cocktails. They're in the $10-12 range for the menu cocktails, but their take on a manhattan is divine. Well drinks are a little cheaper and generously poured. It's dark and wacky like a dive bar but warm like a living room. 

There is often amazing live music. An organ sits behind one end of the bar-- not a simple instrument, but when well-played, it sings. I've heard rumors that Lavay Smith owns the place, so the performers are legit. 

My wallet/liver would be hard-pressed to spend an entire evening here if sticking to the cocktails, but it would have a hell of a time.
author: Krista L.

description: Last time I went the jazz (vocals, organ & trombone) was really good. Overall an excellent bar. Good (dark) atmosphere. Moderately crowded Friday/Sat eve but usually a quiet place to get a drink in late afternoon (patio is great in summer).
author: Daniel N.

description: Really fun place to end the evening. Had the house read and a friend had the house white. Ambiance courtesy of dim red lights and a record player that had to be changed every so often. There are some rules to follow (no service near the organ!), but the service was friendly and quick. Definitely a place to come back to.
author: Aviah M.

description: One of the best bars in the city. I can't give a great explanation of why. Their beer selection is limited.  Drinks are ok. Cash only. But the space is amazing. Come in, grab a beer, listen to the bar organ, and reflect on how good life is.
author: Alek C.

description:
GREAT BAR FOR TRUMP SUPPORTERS....

Witnessed the "bouncer" racially abuse a latino woman, then physically assault her and have to be restrained from beating her.

AVOID THIS BAR AT ALL COSTS

DON'T SUPPORT RACISM
author: Cali J.

description:
Cash only. A bit pricey but I dig the vinyl, decor, lighting, and layout. The barkeeps were polite and attentive and poured with a heavy hand. 

The patio was wet from the recent rain but on a Saturday night it wasn't too packed inside. If you're looking for a nice lounge with a good liquor and beer selection, this place is definitely worth checking out.
author: Trevor B.

description:
A hidden gem!
Do yourself a favor and walk the extra few blocks past the typical going out bars in the Mission and head to the Royal Cuckoo. 
Came here on a Thursday night, the jazz music was playing in the back and there was a decent crowd (mostly couples) relaxing and sipping on cocktails.  My boyfriend and I found seats at the bar as it was not too crowded and the bartender immediately acknowledged us and took our order (not sure why there are so many bad reviews about service here, i thought it was excellent). 
We go the following drinks (very reasonably priced!): 
 - Carnival Mule ($9) - 4.5 stars, similar to a moscow mule, but a bit on the sweeter side due to the Cachaça, but overall refreshing
- Vannessa's Pimms No. 1 Cup ($10) - 5 stars, first off, kudos to a place that gives me a cocktail in a pint glass! And this was so delicious with the combination of apple bitters and fresh cucumber I could have had a few more :)
- Red Ladybug ($10) 4.5 stars - a great Mezcal drink and the sweet "bug juice" balanced nicely with the smokiness of the Mezcal (and this one appropriately looked like a lady bug 

The jazz music playing in the background was great, not too loud, and free! (the musicians do come around and request an optional tip).  This bar made me feel like I traveled back into my grandparents basement, retro furniture, eclectic decor, and old school music. I would highly recommend this bar to anyone looking for a unique experience in the city.
author: Kelsey B.

description: This place gets packed on weekends! It's a chill vibe, lots of seating and pretty good for getting to know people - not too loud. Drinks are a little pricey but nothing crazy. Late 20s-30s crowd most nights. Bartenders and polite and fast.
author: Miranda H.

description: Our favorite dive bar in the city! We love this place for the chill atmosphere and really cute back patio. We sometimes bring our dog and sit back there with our usual crown and coke and whatever cocktail. Bartenders have always been friendly. Remember to bring cash!!! My favorite time come here is right after they open on the weekend and we have the patio to ourselves most of the time!
author: Kelsey S.

description:
I've been a fan of dive bars in norcal for sometime now.
Went drinking with my brother, the local, on a Sunday night.  
We first stop. . .ordered the usual crown and coke.  

They have live musicians.  The inside felt like I went back in time to the 40s or the al copone era.  It was dark and red inside, with an old school feel.  Cozy yet chill.

This place is CASH ONLY.  Luckily, I had my emergency cash with me. Who really carries cash with them nowadays?

Bartenders are really cool!
 But sorry, had to deduct a point for not accepting cards
author: Remie M.

description: Proper bar. Cozy atmosphere, not fancy, local characters/patrons, nice bartender, live music, good cocktails. What more can you ask for a Monday night.
author: Susan E.

description:
Almost don't want to write a review to keep this place a gem. 

It's incredible what people have said about the bartenders and the bouncer in the previous comments. The people I have seen yesterday could be some of the most friendliest people I have encountered in SF, especially the bouncer who took a short walk with us after we left the bar. 

Will definitely be back... with the people that will help keep this place as-is.
author: Gokhan T.

description: Gotta love a dive bar. The best part is the live music behind the bar. Someone always seems to be playing the organ throughout the night. When they're not playing, the bar spins vinyl. Drinks are a little pricey, but the atmosphere is great.
author: Jorge S.

description:
This place is divey, intimate, offbeat. I discovered it on a second date on New Years Eve, after being turned away from El Rio (it was too crowded). I'm pleased that we landed here. The live jazz was amazing (and free), the drinks were lovely and effortless as the sparkling evening gown of our bartender. I'm a sucker for anyplace that serves Pimms or unique variations of the Moscow Mule. Artisanal. It's a buzzword in this city. 

The atmosphere is old school, and the interior is long and narrow. There's cushy seating on the edges, but enough standing room to dance along to vinyl or live renditions of classics. There is also a back patio that offers additional space. Be forewarned, it is cash only and cocktails are a little steep. Prepare your wallets.

My date stole a kiss at midnight, but I returned the kiss so it was only borrowed.

I will be coming back.
author: Nicole C.

description: Looks can be deceiving! I'll admit, I would've never walked into this bar if my boyfriend didn't insist. But don't be fooled- this dive bar is both charming in style and service. And the drinks were incredible! They apparently have live music some nights, but we enjoyed the music they were playing from the record player. Such a good find!
author: Mindy S.

description:
I had a horrible experience at this bar a month and a half ago, and haven't had the time to write this review until now. I've also tried to contact the bar management a couple of times with no luck.

This used to be one of my favorite bars in the neighborhood. Relatively quiet, dark, and with lots of places to sit. The mixed drinks are also amazing. I visited on the evening of my birthday to share a drink with my partner after midnight, and we settled into one of the booths by the door and sat for a while.

After making our drinks, the tender left the bar to sit on a chair somewhat close to us. He was making conversation with a man sitting near him, and after a while, he began almost shouting. I didn't have to eavesdrop to listen to what he was saying. 

He started going on about how he believes that Caitlyn Jenner is "a man who is pretending to be a woman for the money." He began to go in detail describing how the genitalia of trans women work (apparently he's an expert), and told the man how "disgusting" it all is. The way he was speaking made me think that he had been drinking way too much. Opinions about Caitlyn Jenner's character aside, I was extremely disturbed by this, got up, and asked him to keep his what he was saying to himself. He responded by saying "Oh, don't give me that micro aggression bullsh*t". We promptly left, and haven't come back since.

I have brought several of my trans and fellow queer friends to this bar, thinking it was a place that we could feel safe and comfortable enjoying a few drinks. I would love to come back, but I don't feel welcome at all knowing someone so disrespectful might be working. San Francisco might be going to hell, but I would like to hold onto some hope that businesses here have at least basic respect for the existence of queer people.
author: Emma M.

description: I stop by with my wife during the week to enjoy the cool vibes! I loved the live music and the decor surrounding the place. We from out of town would always come back and visit this gem next time.
author: Matt S.

description: If it weren't for the nasty staff this place would be a decent neighborhood joint. Not sure why the staff is so arrogant. Its not like playing music and serving hipster drinks is a groundbreaking idea
author: Lin N.

description:
Vintage Feel Inside... And an Awesome Patio!
May not give you the feel from the out side but has a very cosy patio inside!
author: Vikram C.

description:
This is one of my favorite bars in the mission and SF because this is the only place to travel back in time to the beatnik era of San Francisco. Come here to impress a hot date or show off your bar knowledge to friends in this less frequently visited part of the Mission.

Details: 

The decor gives off of a Beatnik vibe without the commercial feeling of Vesuvio. The cocktails are bold and daring. The carnival mule is a must try. The jazz is amazing. Live covers of Wes Montgomery! The back patio which isn't known to exist by many guests is superb. This place has it all!
author: Robert F.

description:
The bartender was a complete and total entitled fuck. He gave horrible service and was surprised by a 10% tip (btw UH I still tipped you asshole). Dont expect good service from the old man with the sleeves, glasses and baseball cap - expect attitude. 

Too bad- came in because a friend recommended it and the music was such a great find.. Will tell friend that the place has changed.
author: Heather H.

description:
Oh Royal Cuckoo, I'm so glad we ended up driving waaaay too far down Mission on a quest for a bar adventure and thus discovered you. You're a delicious alcoholic venue mashup. "You got martini lounge in my dive bar!... You got dive bar in my martini lounge!"

Ambience: Casual dark dive atmosphere,which is dimly lit with red lighting and table lamps. Assorted cozy seating including barstools, booths, wood benches, couches and leather seats.
Music: Mellow upbeat jazz, courtesy of the organ player and guitarist at the end of the bar.
Hooch: Full bar with good beer selection, specializing in classic cocktails and martinis. Prices are a bit high for the cocktails; they *are* artisan drinks but the venue doesn't quite justify artisan prices. Totally random but I loved the drawings of the angry cuckoo bird scattered throughout the menu!

The *one* issue I had was that my Elderberry Fizz, while very delicious, was hard to drink due to a ton of seeds. I realize seeds are to be expected when your drink contains raspberries, but... have you ever drank an ice-blended drink and keep getting little ice balls that block your straw? Yeah, like that. Not a problem, just slightly off-putting that a plethora of seeds and pulp was impeding my sipping.

Anyway, this cozy little bar was just my kind of place. It reminded me of my favorite hometown bar, PreFlite Lounge. It was so mellow and relaxing, I could've stay there for hours. Thanks, Royal Cuckoo, you're royally cool.
author: Summer M.

description:
I decided to grab a birthday drink at the Royal tonight. There was a visible bouncer at the door who saw us walk in and didn't stop us to then call us out. At this moment he could have asked for our IDs and we would be on our way in but things went a different route.
He started asking question like "have you ever been to a club" "what happens when you go to a club"
I was incredibly confused and thought he was being funny or was trying to just chat. The questions continued...
"I feel like you're showing me no respect" 
Meanwhile other people were entering behind us without getting their IDs check... Finally I'm completely confused and ask him what he wants from us. His response was:
"Get out of here we don't need your money" 
Here is my question, if he needed to check IDs why didn't he ask that in the first place?
author: Amanda G.

description: My favorite local bar. Great backyard patio. Awesome live organ and saxophone music. Super kitsch and eclectic but great vibe.
author: Ashley K.

description: I love this place, there's a cosy vintage feel to it, dim red lights, there's live music and a really cute patio with fairy lights at the back. The cocktails are strong but not over priced. (Beware it's cash only)
author: Olivia M.

description: My favorite watering hole in San Francisco. Everything -- from the decor to the lighting to the bartenders -- is top notch, old-school, the way a dive bar in the city by the bay is supposed to be. During the cold weather months they mix up a great hot brandy cider, but anytime you can get a cocktail at the end of the mission, go here! Warm and cozy, especially when you have the organ player and an accompanist setting the mood with live music. The best little spot to bottoms up!
author: Jake A.

description: It's a charmingly dingy Mission dive with the type of old school music you may hear in a Quentin Tarantino film, red walls, antique art and minimal lighting. Seating is plentiful on a Monday night, where a conversation can flourish, and their drinks will be a step above your standard dive drink. I got a Danish Daisy (vodka, sweet cherry juice, lemon garnish)
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Had my first experience here this past weekend, and I really enjoyed it!

We came at an off-time, maybe 3:30pm on a Saturday, so my group and just one other lady were the only ones there with one bartendress. 

We enjoyed the small outdoor patio and moved inside when we got cold. I really dig the vibe in here--vintage-y and kinda quirky with a really comfortable couch for me and my friends to snuggle up on. It feels like you're having drinks in someone's old house. Plus, the whole experience comes with a snazzy record player! 

The bartendress was extremely nice to me and my friends and she had a heavy hand, so no complaints there. 

I imagine it might get a little hot and packed on during peak hours, but for us, it was like our private little bar for a while! 

All in all, I'm looking forward to coming back!
author: Patrick W.

description: You have amazing drinks. Great ambiance and decor!!! Outside area it's honestly a win win situation! Why 3 stars you ask? I'll tell you... Your bar always smells like vomit! Seriously sour vomit it's gag worthy... And it doesn't matter how much booze I consume. Don't know where it is coming from. Doesn't matter if it is early late now never it always smells like puke. Can you shampoo the carpets or just remove them!? Seriously I think you may get more business! Now that's a win win
author: .Strapped ..

description: I almost don't want to review this place as it's one of the few "best-kepts" around. You will feel transported to a time past, when people had time to chat over a martini or Manhattan with live music going on that didn't require them to scream or be really good lip-readers. This is a true dive bar with a kitschy flare and an eclectic crowd that make me feel right at home. The drinks are well-done and they have just about every spirit you could think of or want, even some fairly high-fallout in' stuff like Carpano Antica and Ancho Reyes. It's fun to have a drink here whether the bar's packed 3 people deep or you get a seat right away.
author: Sandy G.

description: What an excellent surprise! Walked in on a Wednesday night to find a chill scene, ordered a few drinks, and took a seat. A few minutes later the organ and vocalist started up, which captivated me for the rest of the night! Be aware that it is cash only.
author: Alix M.

description: Love this place. They've often got their two man eclectic house band playing in the back of the bar. They have a sweet little backyard space and a tasty drink menu. This place is out of another time.
author: Mark C.

description: This place has a wonderful vibe with jazz, old records, a quaint outdoor area, and absolutely delicious cocktails. The crowd was mostly 30 somethings but somehow this place managed to avoid the "trying too hard to be cool" toxin that often affects bars in this area. It was busy, but not crowded, and everyone seemed like they were really enjoying themselves. Would be delighted to go back.
author: Nate M.

description: This is a hidden gem. This is a great low key spot with excellent live music. The guitarist and organ player were amazing. The drinks and service were good, and the prices reasonable.
author: Clive B.

description: Great spot for drinks with friends. Sorta divy, ok super divy, but fun for sure. When they have the jazz flowing it feels especially cozy.
author: Erin W.

description: Bar was wet and unkempt, cash only, bartender chatted up people and ignored people waiting on drinks.
author: Brent J.

description: Like so many others, I'm not a fan of the bartenders here since they're typically very rude. The place is a bit too dark for me and I end up wanting to fall asleep after 1 drink. There are better bars close by, so avoiding The Royal Cukoo isn't a loss.
author: Jan S.

description:
This is crazy.

Our path to cocktails.

Those cocktails being smooth, strong and just $17 for a pair.

Enjoying the pair while enjoying live jazz.

Completely taken by the dark, intimate vibe while being completely taken care of by the friendly and prompt bartenders.

This is four stars.
author: Jason B.

description: Amazing atmosphere, LOVE the organ, and live music, but cash only, plus awful cocktails! My boyfriend and I have returned a couple times hoping the last time we just had a bad bar tender, but every time we leave disappointed. Last time I could only drink half before we just gave up and left. What's the point of a bar if you can't enjoy your drink? Just get a beer if you do go...
author: Allison Z.

description: This is a cool little spot on Mission that includes live jazz music! Score! It's so rare to see it nowadays so this was a good treat. It's a bit divey and messy, just the way I like it. Drinks are ok, service is fine.
author: Kemi A.

description: I fell in love as soon as I stepped inside. I love the live music and the albums on the wall! The bartenders were super friendly and the whole kitschy feel of the place just made me feel right at home, They have a cool back patio too! The only word of warning is for anyone that finds low lighting to be a turn off...it's pretty dark in there, but that doesn't bother me at all! I went on a Saturday around 8pm, and it was perfect. It was lively and not too crowded. I will definitely be going back!
author: Caddy M.

description:
First time in the place. The service here was terrible so they get a low review  from me.  3 stars because i hate to judge on 1 or 2 employees. But I knock them another star for the cash only bullcrap in 2014   For that alone I won't come back. 

So all i can say is it was perplexing watching the female bartender not only fail to acknowledge 2 patrons sitting right at the bar but to continue to serve one side for 10 minutes. It was a non busy night!. Finally my friends patience wore thin and she spoke up (personally i turned it into a game to see how long this could possibly go on) when new people entered and stood next to the bar and were served before us. 

We had to speak to the male bartender who finally came back from whatever he was doing. We were joking out loud since it was the first time we had ever been maybe we weren't local enough or looked wrong.
author: Matt W.

description:
I felt right at home here and I hope that you stick around forever. You are one of the few remaining venues to have live Jazz/Blues. Who else has an organ at the end of the bar and plays only vintage vinyl on the lo-fi?

I'll be back!

I heart you.

That is all.
author: Lisa A.

description: I always wanted to go to this place and I was not disappointed. Nice and dark with live music. Very friendly staff and great drinks. They were so fun and helpful and I cant wait to go back!
author: Louie M.

description: I ended up at this bar quite by accident. I went to the blue plate a few doors down for dinner but there was a wait. The hostess sent me to Royal Cuckoo until a table became available. We walked in to a dark bar with live music and a fantastic atmosphere. People were chatty and friendly the drinks were awesome they mixed a great martini for me the way I ordered it and we enjoyed listening to keyboards and saxophone while waiting for our table. We quite accidentally stumbled into a perfect evening. I also highly recommend the Blue Plate a few doors down for fusion Southern cooking.
author: Teresa M.

description: They have awesome hand-crafted beers for a good price and I really enjoyed the dimly lit ambiance of this place. I was told that there's live music until 11pm, but we got there around midnight so they were playing music on a music player. However, I find the crowd and bartender to not be that friendly.
author: Wendy H.

description: Great drinks, great vibe, and Brian is a master at his craft. Thanks for being my go to place for crafted cocktails in the Mission! The sazerac and the last word are amazing. Consistent and competent. Love this place!
author: Chris B.

description: Guys, I love this bar. It has an organ built into the bar for godsakes. However, the service is completely rude and disrespectful. Tonight I tried to enter the bar to meet my two friends. There were two men engaged in conversation at the side of the door. Apparently one of them had the job of asking for IDs but didn't because he was chattin up his friend. So i walked in and then one guy asked for my ID. I apologized and said I didn't realize he was checking IDs and for the next 15 minutes I was lectured by this guy about how disrespectful I was for not respecting his position. I immediately presented him with my ID and he continued to lecture me, barring me from entering.The manager went outside to smoke and I asked him to intervene, since I was getting nowhere and just wanted to meet my friends. He shrugged the whole thing off and so then this guy lectured me for not respecting him enough by asking for another dude to intervene. Finally, I asked my friends to leave the bar and they soon informed me they entered the bar without their iDs even being checked. Apparently if you're a single woman, you're game for men unleashing their anger at the door. I've been going to this bar for a decade but I'm warning my friends off it from now on. Also, the guy threatened me after I returned to initiate a conversation with the manager.  I'd welcome a conversation from the door man. The whole interaction was obviously about way more than me.
author: Emily B.

description: I signed up for Yelp just so I could respond to Megan K's review. I was also at Royal Cuckoo last night and her review is absolutely ridiculous. The bartender working was beyond nice and my drink was delicious. Megan and her group were RUDE and obnoxious and their behavior was not only appalling as grown ass humans, but as someone who claims to be in the industry, absolutely uncalled for. While the bartender was trying to get them change, one of the girls threw the contents of her drink over the bar and when the bartender told them to finish their drinks and leave (rightfully so they were acting like idiots) they started yelling and causing a scene. Megan, it was YOUR boyfriend trying to start a fight and telling the bartender they could take things outside. Yes, the bartender did say you guys should go back to the Marina, which is where I also thought you guys lived because it's mind blowing that you guys would act so ridiculous in any neighborhood, but especially a neighborhood that was yours. I love Royal Cuckoo and it makes me happy to hear that you and your friends will never go there again. Also, I thank whoever in your group said "I don't live in the Marina, look at this beard. I live in the Mission." Quote of the night.
author: Jenny K.

description:
last night i witnessed two bartenders being completely unprofessional and down right rude to some girl who wanted less alcohol in her drinks. 

what was the big deal? she made requests and was kind plus she tipped them well. for the life of me i didn't understand why she stayed. a black woman and some guy in glasses were loudly making fun of her in front of everyone at the bar. even the guy sitting next to her asked her why are these guys being such jerks to her. she shrugged and said no clue. i saw her ignore them and she seemed to to be doing her own thing. i would of left. 

i was there for several hours and watched them roll their eyes and mock her. for what?  she was just sitting there like normal and drinking like everyone else.

i've been coming here a long time and it didn't sit well with me.  it's hard to believe they would treat a paying customer who was normal and nice so badly. don't make requests here or else.
author: Noel J.

description:
3 stars because they play a record player vs a digital jukebox and the drinks are good.. It is a bar after all. 
But.. The crowd here is a bit unwelcoming- a bit of a phenomenon in this neighborhood. And the bartenders are not exactly friendly. Cash only adds to my frustration.
Unfortunately for cuckoo- el rio is a few doors down so.. Options abound.
author: Sydney S.

description: Great spot. Love the garden at the back, the live music and the drinks. Hot apple brandy when it's cold and strawberry fresca with tequila when it's not. What's not to like?
author: Felicity B.

description:
Taxidermy, shabby couches, a Hammond, and old records.

Drinks can be somewhat inconsistent, but the atmosphere and live music make up for it.
author: Amanda R.

description:
This bar has a very nice vibe. The music is quiet and relaxing and there is even a small outdoor patio if you're brave enough to hang out in the generally cold nighttime weather SF throws at us. 

My friends and I sat at the bar, as it was a particularly cold night, and had a few drinks. It's pretty dark inside so we had to use our phones to read the menu but who cares? It's all in the name of ambiance. The bartender got to us pretty quickly and was attentive without being pushy. 

All-in-all I really liked this bar. I'm a big fan of any place with good live music.
author: Brittany N.

description: I love this place. I can't vouch for how it is here on weekends, but on hump night, it's perfectly chill, great atmosphere with the help of the organ player. I had a Cismontane imperial stout...after noticing the tiny sign that says no bar service by the organ. Got it.
author: Maximillian M.

description:
Love love love love this place.

I stumbled into this bar and all I can say is that I love it. The drinks here are super delicious and have a wide range of specialty drinks here. The bartender is incredibly nice and go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and tended to. 

Super duper plus: LIVE JAZZ MUSIC. So you can sip on your crazy good Manhattan while listening to some incredible jazz. This place is also not crazy crowded since it is far up on Mission - so you get the real boozers. 

Come here if you want incredible drinks, great music, and great place for conversation!
author: Pablo P.

description:
This is a pretty funky bar. It's got a whimsical feeling due to all the fun decorations. Drinks are fairly strong and reasonably priced (cocktails from $6-12). The bar tender did a great job. 

The jazz is a lot of fun, and there's no cover
author: Rebecca L.

description: Great music. Cool decor. Good service. Dark. Wait, that's vinyl? Wait, is that actually an old dude playing an actual organ? Holy shit this bar is amazing!
author: Patrick S.

description: This place is very San Francisco of the past.  No hi-tech splashiness but instead a library of vinyl in original paper sleeves, quirky outsider art, a recycled stuffed deer's head calmly observing, and a musical organ.  Usually a one-Irish-whiskey-chat-with-the-barkeep stop.
author: Poet D.

description: Ok well I'm happy I wasn't just really losing my vision (although I do have poor vision) and it really was that dark .Thank you other YELPers for pointing it out as well. Cool homey decor,love the records playing .That shrub julep specialty drink is superb! So so friendliness in the service department but human beings are just that,human. I'm not that shining in the nice department on a consistent basis either. I would definitely come back,but I'd really like there to be more illumination. Ambience is cool, but DARK is quite another
author: Lauren V.

description: This is the ideal bar.  Great atmosphere, suffused red lighting, nice music but quiet enough to be able to hear the person you're with (what a concept!), charming patio, large cocktail menu (perhaps a bit pricey, but good), and very friendly service. A rare find!
author: Ben R.

description:
Had drinks here recently with friend.   The bar is on the ass-end of the Mission, almost in South SF.   It's dark and musty, but classic dive bar style. 

The bartender was very friendly and kept playing cool old Elvis and Roy Orbison Vinyl.

Good selection of hard stuff and beer, which is all you'd want to drink here anyways.
author: Max K.

description:
A little bit out of the way, but honestly, it's a stumble and half-hop from the 24th street BART station just beyond the Cesar curve.

Nice beer selection and around $4-5 per pint. Green Flash IPA was tasty enough. Not too crowded on a Friday night and the people buzz was rumbling enough for you to have conversations amidst the background noise. Not sure what the theme of the joint is, but there are plenty o' mounted animal heads..
author: Kevin L.

description:
They have a Hammond Organ.  BEHIND THE BAR.  That is all.

Seriously.  Hand-made artisanal (WTF is this as a label in front of everything these days, anyway?) cocktials.

Talented musicians.  Dark, cool vibe.  Just a few minutes walk from my pal's place in Glen Park.  A very nice way to end an evening.
author: Persimmon V.

description:
I liked it! Nice selection of signature cocktails up on the chalkboard- I had a manhattan, my date had something with a ginger beer base, and then we shared a creative margarita variant. Lights are fairly dim, which I thought added to the ambiance. We sat down at the end of the "organ bar" - he wasn't playing then, but apparently there's a live organist at certain times. Tunes while we were there were from a nice selection of old LPs, DJ'd by one of the bartenders.

Overall, it seems like a nice addition to this part of Mission. Good place to have a drink before Blue Plate or Locavore, when you're not feeling like the loudness of the Knockout :)
author: Thomas R.

description: Intimate cocktail bar with dim red lighting and chill vibe.
author: Lara W.

description: Hey dip shit last time I checked your hours said you were open until 2am.  It's barely 1am and your "fucking make it quick I already called last call" doesn't cut it.  Sorry to inconvenience you and trying to put money in your pocket.
author: Juan L.

description: Nice cocktail menu. Cheese puff ball thingies!!! Live music. Great decor but the lighting is a bit dark. Lovely bar tenders. Diverse crowd. Away from Valencia madness. Love it!
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Any place that has a Hammond Organ that gets played regularly, and very well I might add, gets a gold star from me. 
Came here on a sunday night, organ was in full rotation, Lavay Smith singing some great tunes, good friends to sit with and drink and enjoy. 
decent drinks, cash only. 
Nice vibe, easy going. I should come here more often I say to myself when I am here. 
Only thing I want here is a small drink menu that I can look at before I order instead of looking at the dimly lit wall. 
Probably too crowded on weekends, but most any other night of the week is just fine.
These folks deserve your patronage.
author: Adrian M.

description:
Went here yesturday after Pride for a nice mellow drink. The nice thing with this bar is you get just this if you go. There was a mixture of live organ music playing and old records as well. Very dimly lit, so great date atmosphere, if you want it. A nice mixture of mismatched couches, chairs, benches here so you can find you own little nook to sit in. I don't drink hard alcohol, so just had a beer on tap, but this place seems like they would make very good cocktails. 

A nice little place, that I recommend stopping into if you are in the neighborhood. :)
author: Goth Kitty Jen J.

description: Would you like to pay $6 for a terrible beer in a wannabe dive bar? No? Me neither.
author: Steve P.

description:
This place is super Dark, however who needs light when your drinking those strong cocktails. I had an amazing time here despite the fact I had to pay an ATM fee because they don't except credit cards. 

It's that Bar you would actually want to go to after work, small, relaxing with amazing staff and drinks.
author: Lannette G.

description:
Been here a few times.  The inside is dark, which makes it a little hard to read their great cocktail menu, but there is a better lit back patio.  I love their drinks, made strong but seriously tasty.  
Atmosphere is well suited for a relaxing evening, and with the strong drinks and dark lighting, it works great for mellow last stop on a date.
author: Samantha G.

description:
Fun place for a round of drinks in Bernal Heights--we stumbled across it while walking aimlessly from the Mission. Small and dark with red tones, and the decor reminded me of an old-fashioned sailor's saloon (or what I imagine one would have been like, anyway).  A guy was playing an organ and an older gentleman was singing the blues.  

I agree with the previous reviewer who suggested a little more lighting for the specials board.  I couldn't actually read what was up there.  I just had a basic vodka sour, nothing special but it was good enough for me.

I doubt I'd spend a whole night there, but I would gladly go back for a drink.
author: Kate Marie G.

description:
This bar is a lovely addition to the neighborhood. Other than some delicious cocktails (not the best ever, but still pretty creative), I love the fact that they have an organist. I had a great time here recently when I stumbled in on a Wednesday night to find the bouncer singing some sultry blues/soul tunes, accompanied by the organ. 

The owners have great taste in music, and when the ivories aren't being tickled, they're spinning vinyl records. Everything sounds better on vinyl. It's a fact.
author: Christina S.

description:
Angry Birds have landed.

Watered-down overpriced drinks ... and really bad service.  Oh yeah ... good times for all ... NOT !!!

Angry owner and bartenders act like they just escaped the funny house.  I suppose that explains the name .. the royal cuckoos.

Hammond organ is cool ... too bad the bartenders' attitude drowns out the vibe.  Far better places nearby.

Checkout ... The Knockout ... just across the street.
author: J B.

description:
I really like this place.  

Cute, quaint, neighborhood bar with an organist playing jazz tunes on Saturdays. Score! My cocktails have always been tasty and potent, no complaints there. "Cash only" is my only complaint.
author: Emille L.

description: Oh my god! Go listen to Jules Broussard here!  Go have drinks made by Pete!  Go hang out in the coolest place in the world!
author: Alex T.

description: I love the atmosphere in here how it's small and dark almost like a dungeon. The drinks are pricey like every other bar but the staff are friendly and no there way around a cocktail. I also like the music, the night I went they were playing soulful music. This is a small and can be a relaxing place to get a few drinks with friends it almost feels like a party in your living room. But getting here a little bit early won't hurt if you're trying to get the comfy chair !!
author: Gracelove C.

description: Dark but not dingy-- a good place to grab a drink.  Not particularly great prices, but not wildly over-priced either.  Drinks here aren't anything to write home about or anything, but they can mix a drink just like any other bar can.  It's your standard fare drink menu, etc.  But it's cash-only... which I do not find charming; I find it unnecessarily cumbersome and deeply, deeply annoying.
author: Tarah D.

description: Slow, rude bartenders. Sad 'cause it's a cool space but 15 min to get a drink sucks. Go home hipster douche bags... you're almost worse than techie douche bags.
author: Isuris O.

description:
This bar has cool decor with intimate lighting. Think Paxton's Gate with booze. I really wanted to like this joint. It's only two blocks from my house.
But I've been there three times, and walked away disappointed or down-right agitated on every occasion. 
It's poorly operated with rude and inexperienced bartenders, which is ridiculous for a place charging $10 for cocktails. The drinks are often watery. 
On the most recent visit the bartender twice cleared drinks before we'd finished them. One was a $9 cocktail that was literally half full when it was cleared off the bar without a word to us. When my friend politely mentioned they were clearing away drinks too quickly, she was told to essentially piss off. Hmm...if I'm drinking $2 PBRs at a dive bar I might expect that reply. But not after paying $9 for a drink.
I'm totally bummed that this place sucks so bad.
author: Nate P.

description: First world problems I know, but 25 minutes for a drink on a slow night is not ok.  We hope the singer will stop bartending and start singing again soon.
author: Beth E.

description: Great cocktails in a dive bar with records playing and dark corners. Eclectic with a cute patio. Beers, scotches/whiskey, and cocktails for all types. Cash only but has ATM. No TVs!!!
author: Caitlin R.

description: Great spot at the corner of Mission and Valencia. I've ridden my bike past many times, and finally decided to meet a friend for drinks there on a Friday night. They had a solid list of signature cocktails, including a Gin & Tonic like nothing I'd had before. The service was fast and simple too. The best part though, was that they were spinning vinyl when I walked in. That was topped off by a Sax player and Keyboardist jamming out. The Sax player took the cake though. Royal Cuckoo is a great place to check out if you like bars in the Mission and are looking for something new to do.
author: Jason W.

description:
I believe it was Tuesday night our drunken debacherous behinds wandered to the new Royal Cuckoo where Mission and Valencia meet. We had just left the late night happy hour at South End on 26th and Valencia so this way an easy couple block walk.

For a new place it was pretty full for a Tuesday night. My BF told us it used to be a ghetto fabulous venue called Belinda's frequented mainly by the 26 Mix crowds grand parents as well as those who wanted to get into 26 mix but could not do to improper foot wear. Not anymore! Now it's a hot, although fairly small venue, done in the new look so popular with bars these days- hunting lodge chic. Complete with you guessed it- a moose head!! I really liked all the wood furniture and paneling. It really does look nice in there!

The drinks were good, service was quick and efficient- although not memorable. As a bartender myself I consider it a small minus if the bartender is so unsocial I literally can't recall if it was a male or femal who served us. But I can remember the color of the wood used in the decor. But as I said, our drinks were strong, quick, and fairly priced so I still give The Royal Cuckoo a 4 over all.
author: Lisa H.

description: Ambiance and drinks are great. Unfortunately, the pretension (from the door man to the bartender) overshadows the charm.
author: Lauren M.

description: Great neighborhoody bar with an edge. Cool records. One of the bartenders was sort of rude to my friend, but that added to the ambiance.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I liked the dim atmosphere and the hand-crafted cocktails. (They make a stand-up sidecar.)  I could do without the taxidermy, but I suppose it was a tasteful display of dead things.

If you're there with a pal or date, this is a good spot for a cozy night.  If you're there with a party of 4 and want to chat, it's awkward.  You either have to line up on a pew, or try putting barstools into a semi-circle.  Add loud music in the background, and you'll be likely to have a drink and move on, as we did.  I'd encourage the Cuckoo to work on seating for small groups.
author: Andi T.

description:
It's not that there is anything wrong with this place.... it's just that we've all seen it a million times before.

The red walls, the chandeliers, the cash only policy, the wooden bar made to look old even though it just got installed, the taxidermy, the clientele in black clothes and ironic mustaches....  

For $11 cocktails, I would love to see something new.

And the irony of church pews as seating is over-ridden by the memories of church pews as church seating.  Can't someone make something happy happen in this neighborhood?

The live organ is a mixture of pleasure and pain every time it starts.

If you want to continue your "Mission Experience Bar Stroll" then please drop in.  If you are looking for something new in this new bar, you are in the wrong place.
author: Melanie R.

description:
I've agonized over this review.  Not because there's anything wrong with the Royal Cuckoo, there just didn't seem to be anything special about it.

The taxidermy stuff is not my thing and since I just stopped in for a quick drink, I wasn't going to play an album (the other thing they're known for).

I just wanted a cocktail.  A really good cocktail.  

Okay, so I ordered the wrong thing.  I wanted a margarita.  You know a pucker up, tart margarita.  The red Margarita, is NOT that margarita.

I read the ingredients, but somehow missed that there didn't seem to be any kind of lime juice in it.  So is this really even a margarita?

At $11 for this cocktail (um, you're two doors down to a Burger King), I wasn't in the mood to see if the next $11 would be the magic potion.

I'm sure that the bartender would have remade this, but it was own damn fault.

I will be going back for the Manhattan though.
author: Michael M.

description: Worst experience of my life!! If it were possible to leave zero stars,I certainly would.  I came in tonight with a few friends, all bartenders, including myself, and had the absolute worst possible service from the bar tender to the point where her cussed at us and screamed at us and asked to fight my boyfriend. All because we were nicely asking to replace a disgusting drink that clearly wasn't made correctly. The bar tender got so offended for saying the drink was no good (after 4, very well seasoned bartenders tried it and could not even swallow) and yelled at us "Go back to the marina!"  When we are clearly from and employed in  bernal heights! Unfortunately this bar is one my boyfriend has visited often throughout the past 5 years and was excited to show the 8 of us. After our extremely negative experience we asked for a receipt since clearly the amount of money the bartender was asking for was clearly far off from the amount ordered. After asking nicely for a receipt the bar tender said he couldn't give us one and asked jokingly if we wanted him to hand write one. Aside from his rude demeanour this is absolutely ILLEGAL to not provide a receipt! This bar tender is CLEARLY  making up his own prices and refusing to provide proof of price in order to increase his own personal intake!!  This experience was so foul I not only will never revisit, but I will spend every moment telling all of my  own regulars where to NEVER go! Absolutely appalled that someone like this bartender is even employed! I used to really value going around to neighborhood bars and talking "liquor" with fellow bar tenders, but clearly whoever hired this person was not in their right mind. For whoever this person is, I want to let you know I know plenty of sweet, good looking bar tenders who would happily take his spot and make you so much more money, you are so much better off without this rude, aggressive individual.
author: Megan K.

description:
I like this bar.  No jukebox, no djs.  Instead there's an organist on a Hammond accompanied by the bouncer on harmonica.  They have rotary speakers which my geeky friends stood around in awe pointing out the tubes and the retro analogness of it all.  This is why you can hear each other speak without screaming.  Points for that.

And of course they have good drinks.  Great addition to that neighborhood even though it probably displaced another cholo bar...
author: X X.

description: My bar of bars! Small, dark, eclectic, great live music (live organ music? Yes please!), great cocktails (some cheap, some not) and great staff! THE ROYAL CUCKOO always has a good vibe and since it's walking distance to my place, it's become my local watering hole, I am indeed a fan!
author: G C.

description:
I checked out this brand spanking new, cool and cozy new venue in the Bernal Height / Mission area.  The crowd was really interesting and the staff were nice.  They've got this crazy hammond organ and I caught some great musicians there including singer Lavay Smith, an amazing sax player, and another singer named Amber who's voice and style would make anyone stop and listen.
It's located near some other bars, some with live music, so it's a cool area to hop around. 
I can't give it five stars because I haven't hung out there enough.
I look forward to going back and seeing what sorts of scenes develop there.
author: Michael P.

description:
Liked the decor but too dark.  The record library and organist were nice touches.

If you're going to write your drinks on a chalkboard, put some lighting up there.  Not sure what was in our drinks, though I dug the Bitter Cup.  

Probably opt for Iron and Gold over this spot for a mellow drink but this is a nice starting drink for a fun night out.  Just a bit loud and a bit dark.
author: AP R.

description:
Neat little place with good music and a cool interior. It's not fancy, but it's really nice. I don't really know how else to describe it. It's quaint, I suppose.

I came here on a saturday night with a friend and it was pretty crackin'. It was so crowded towards the back that I gave up on trying to reach the bathroom and used the one across the street. 

Onto the reason why I came in here .(to get fucked up, duh!).  I ordered the something something 'mule'. It's some $8 drink on their chalkboard menu. I honestly can't tell ya what's in it cuz I don't remember. (was somewhat inebriated already) I just remember reading 'ginger beer'. The taste of the drink seemed to resemble a caipirinha, but instead of using lime, it was oranges. STRONG MOTHA FUCKIN' DRINKS! which is a + + + + + +!

I will definitely be back if I'm in the area again =)
author: Bonita C.

description:
The elk head over bar makes N. feel right at home. Reminds me like pet reindeer we keep on winter retreat in Samiland. 

Natashka make short haiku in honor of new favorite bar:

if more bourbon in 
manhattan with blue cherry
best bar in SF
author: natashka o.

description:
I've been to this bar twice now, both times were great. 

First, the atmosphere is great. Don't let anyone fool you though, you won't find any more taxidermy here than a local Elks lodge. Just a couple birds and a deer head. I appreciate a bar with the dim, candlelit vibe. There's a lot of seating, the bar has coat hooks, and at the end of the bar is an organ. The first night I came in (on a Wednesday) someone was playing it. 

They have the usual San Francisco bar beers (Anchor, Modelo, etc.) and some great cocktails. The bar would get 5 stars except they didn't seem to have any discernible happy hour. I would definitely recommend this as a chill place for a first date. Even when the bar is full you can still hear each other talk.
author: Beth D.

description: this place is wonderful! Hope it always stays this charming!
author: Erica R.

description: Love this place. Dark, comfortable, always great music, friendly bartenders that know how to make and pour a proper drink. Please do not come here.
author: k m.

description: I used to think this was a great bar, however on NYE, we experienced (2) "off duty" employees (bartenders, they said) that were sitting at the bar in a prime area.  A friend tried to get a drink and may have bumped into one of these guys.  Instead of brushing it off (given it was a packed bar and a busy night), they decided to be rude and tell my friend to "go powder you nose".  Not a placed I'd go to again given the total rudeness of these two "employees".
author: Rachel P.

description: 4 for the mood, - 3 for the barkeep:   SCOLDED ME LIKE SHE WAS MY MOM because she didn't hear my order.  What a shame.
author: Kevin L.

description: LOVE this place!!!  It reminds me of a mini-Cafe DuNord.  Always great drinks and great music.  They still spin old vinyl and have amazing live music.
author: Nancy M.

description: I love dark, cavernous bars that make the day feel like night. I'm mainly a beer drinker (and jami neat), so i didn't get anything mixed, but watched the tender (who is an owner of this bar and chez spencer) make some pretty rigorous drinks. Was entertaining, and to boot... Lavay Smith came on around 7 with just a keyboardist for the sunday night live show. What a great boost to the already very cool environment. Great bar, great music, personal service. Def will be back with regularity.
author: Adam X.

description: Friendly bartenders, decent cocktails. No jukebox, but they do have a card catalog system for vinyl records, stashed behind the bar. Pick a record and it'll get added to the queue. Cash only.
author: Clarke W.

description:
Don't believe the hype. Cool space. 
Drinks either terrible or aaiiit depending on the bah'tendah.  (At least one of the ladies working there is amazing!)
author: Minotaur N.

description: Incredible guy singing old classics with live organist. That's really all that needs to be said. But I guess I will add that the atmosphere is nice and dark and cozy with plenty of seating. I'm not sure why people call this a hipster bar, I've been there a few times now and there were zero hipsters, but then, I don't have a problem with hipsters! People are people. I would love to see a more LGBT crowd though....
author: danica s.

description: The Royal Cuckoo is fantastic.  The mix of amazing live music, friendly patrons, and intriguing decor will keep me coming back for a long time.
author: Jon T.

description: great atmosphere , and live music , ok selection of beers , the bad is the old broken sofa at the end of room, caused me and a friend some itchynes
author: Rafael G.

description: Cool bar, nice people, good drinks...and a Hammond B3
author: Mike J.

description: This is one of my favorite bars in SF. I am in love with the ambiance, the weird pin-up girls, the antlers, the dark red and wooden furniture, and I love the music. They have a file card anthology of all of the records they have and you can suggest whatever ones suit you, and if you're nice and they're not too busy, you will get to control the jams. If you're lucky, you'll show up when there is live music and be serenaded by electric organ and if you're REALLY lucky, you'll be there when the amazing saxophone player who can play two saxes at the same time is there!
author: Gracie S.

description: Nice vintage-like cocktail bar hidden in Bernal Heights. Organ music with a trumpet and/or sax 3 days a week. The drinks are stiff for workforce champions.
author: Silicon W.

description: Ambiance: Hipster? I think no. The partons are way too old to be considered hipster. More like Yupster.
author: inejiro a.

description:
Delighted that this new bar rolled into my hood, with surprisingly little pomp & circumstance. I've been here several times and each time has been delightful, particularly the time for a post-hike chimay on a drizzly afternoon. 

Not sure what bartenders the previous reviewers have encountered, but on each of my visits I've been welcomed with a great bartender, unique-yet-classic and well-made (not to mention strong) drinks, great lighting, and a place to sit. The doorman also doubles as a harmonica player at times!

One disclaimer: while great at other times, the "bitter cup" is not a good idea at the end of a big night...
author: Kristen R.

description: This bar is trying. Really trying. Lackluster, but sippable drinks in a dark, dingy setting. Hip crowd, but something was amiss. I'd rather spend my money at the Lone Palm.
author: Juls M.

description:
We were delighted to see a funky new bar pop up where the crusty, uninviting Belinda's used to be. We liked it just fine. 

The cocktails were a bit pricey, and the martini wasn't all that great. 
But I got a nice pour of Jameson. 

The bartender wasn't going out of his way, personality-wise, but the 33 rpm record he was spinning helped add a little charm. 

We'll try it again.
author: Bonnie B.

description: Great drinks and amazing atmosphere. Not a good place to come alone but wonderful for couples and groups of friends.
author: Aaron W.

description:
Nice little neighborhood bar and I do mean little.  Room capacity is 49 according to the sign by the door.

Comfy though seating though the bar stools are slightly wobbly (no I wasn't drunk, they were wobbly when I got there sober).  Staff is friendly and the bartenders seem on their game.  The place is a little light on the cocktails for a person like me who never knows what they want.

They are right on the corner of Valencia and Mission, great location for drink but sucky for parking.  On the plus side, the 14 stops 1 door down and hey, who wants to drive home from a bar?
author: Shauna R.

description:
I was there for an event earlier this month and the place is alright. I can't rate the drinks but can say they are too expensive for me to order anything other than a beer on tap.

Also, the space is a bit cramped even if the people are really cool. The bathrooms, while crowded and cramped, seemed pretty clean. The barroom though was too dark for my standards and the music was alright if you're into old records.

They do have interesting sounding drinks though, which is always a plus if you have the money for them.
author: Xhris C.

description: Royal Cuckoo is good for a dark, intimate atmosphere with a strong cocktail (not a lot of beer options). Sometimes they've got live music (often jazzy, no cover charge) which is great. Other times, they've got the record player going (nothing post 1950). Easily crowds but is a nice, cozy place.
author: Roxy B.

description: One of the best bars in the world. Thank god for bad Yelp reviews keeping a seat open for me. Great live music constantly, velvet suited doorman, unpretentious drinks, and lots of nooks to cozy up with a date. Magical time portal hideout from the dystopia. I wish I were there right now.
author: Danny T.

description:
I really want to love this place. I really want to be able to give it a four-star. Alas I have been leaning towards giving it a two-star. So instead I'll just go with the average.

Where to begin? Sigh...

The RC has all the makings of a perfect neighborhood spot. A uniquely difference place for people to enjoy some conversation and good drinks. Instead it is almost going out of its way to make conversation difficult.

Tonight I went there with a bud for some long-overude catch up time. But unfortunately I COULD NOT HEAR HIM. He's a professional actor, makes a decent living doing so. I mean, the guy knows how to project his voice. But it's no match for the Hammond organ blaring from behind the end of the bar, played by a Jimmy Smith wannabe. JESUS CAN YOU TURN THAT THING DOWN ?!?  If I wanted to have a musical experience to overwhelm the senses, I would have stopped a few doors down at El Rio. But guess what. You're not El frikkin Rio. You're the much chiller-looking place with the comfy looking chairs and the taxidermy. So turn down the fucking organ. 

Yes, it's cool you have an organ there. YOU'RE cool to have a bar with a goddamn organ in it. You've arrived, man. Congratulations. Now please stop shoving it down the throats of your patrons.

And if you're going to serve shmancy cocktail drinks in this neighborhood and charge $8 for them, they ought to be a bit less watery. At least make it seem like you're trying.
author: Rick S.

description:
Awesome place. Went there on a Friday night with a date and everything about the bar was spot on: the ambiance, the live music, not too loud and the right-sized crowd.

Only quip: it doesn't accept credit cards? That's annoying, sorry, if your drinks are more than $5 each. The bar lost business because I left once I ran out of cash and decided to go to a bar across the street... but I would have gladly stayed longer. (There might have been an ATM somewhere but who wants to spend $5 on fees?)
author: Pierre B.

description: This place is much better than the old dive bar that was there before.  The ambiance is pretty cool and laid back.  The decor is pretty interesting old pews from churches, elk head mounted over the bar.  Drinks are reasonably priced, and they had live saxophone music on the night we went.
author: Loretta M.

description: Organist playing pop music!  Cool old-school vibe.  Definitely a little bit too "hip" for me, but definitely worth coming to.  Next time I'm going to come earlier and on more of an "off" night.  I came last Thursday and it was really packed, to the point where I felt like a hipster sardine.
author: Julia D.

description: Great drink menu.  Good place for a date.  Live jazz music!
author: around town e.

description: After the SFWeekly write up about this place I figured it was worth the 10 minute walk from my house... I'm not sure that it was. Granted I made the mistake of taking advice from a lame publication, so I guess the joke is on me! The decor of this place is really fun. The Christmas lights around the bar combined with the taxidermied animals hung above the bar made me a feel a bit like I was in some little town in Montana (in a good way!). Add the organ and the woman with the gravelly voice singing jazz and this was beginning to be one of my favorite new spots. The problems didn't start until the drinks came. Bad, bad, bad, and in an epic way. I had the Daisy drink and it honestly tasted as if they'd taken water and lemon concentrate and then called it a day. My husband's was just as bad, the flavors were totally unbalanced and once again watery. All in all, do yourself a service and avoid their specialty cocktails at all costs. I'd come again and order wine, but if their cocktails are any indication I'm afraid it will have been fermented in a toilet.
author: Kathryn M.

description: The atmosphere of this former cantina is dark and lounge like - I love it!  It's hard to come with more than 4 friends at a time because the seating isn't set up for a larger crowd - more of an intimate - 2-3 people in the party type of place.  The bartenders are really nice.  I love that they have Green Flash on tap - I hope they never get rid of that!   If I had one recommendation it would probably be to improve the early evening music selection which tends to be opera.  Kinda random.
author: Heather F.

description: This place would be a great neighborhood bar (not really someplace you'd travel much of a distance to visit) if the staff weren't super rude to customers.  Really unfortunate that they're staff have single-handedly ruined my hopes for having another comfortable bar to hang out in around the corner from my house.
author: Lin N.

description: This place is legit. There's an organ built into the bar. There's excellent red mood lighting. There's a back patio for when it gets too hot and crowded. And best of all, if you show up on Fridays, there's a man who can play two saxophones at the same time. Please don't come here, because I like the fact that there's still only a handful of people here on the weekends.
author: Matt B.

description: Seating is limited but the organ is forever. Friendly place.
author: Klevin D.

description: Louis Armstrong's late brother as the door man... Sweet tunes floating from the organ being played inside... dark, musty, a hodgepodge of random eccentricities hanging on the wall...and a chalkboard full of refreshing microbrews...this is my kind of bar! Why can't you be in the Richmond? Hahaha. Okay, so don't answer that. But seriously, was fun to just sit back on the couch with a friend, enjoy the tunes and drink a cold brew or three. Check it out if you're in the area!
author: Leigh W.

description: Really nice place, a classy joint! It's dark in there, bring a flashlight. Hey!, don't really bring a flashlight, someone will laugh at you or think condescending thoughts about you. F*#%@ those people. Physically or meta-ly. Seems like a good place to get started, then move on, before you fall asleep. Remember, it's dark in there. Pillow talk. When I went, it was pretty slow, like a snail, no slimy trails though. Tuesday evening, that makes sense. I would come back here. Cause of this place I wrote a strange review. Oh well. [POST]
author: Brian S.

description: This place is the embodiment of a 4 star bar. Cool atmosphere, stiff drinks (I recommend the rosy nail...), and not too overpopulated (yet...but it's still pretty new). I'm glad it replaced the trashy pool bar that used to be in its location, and I also enjoy its extreme proximity to Taqueria Cancun Sorry, Knockout. You've been ousted for coolest bar in stumbling distance to Cancun. There's nothing I dislike more than paying cover in order to pay for some drinks.  I'm not sure what it is about it that  misses the Woohoo factor, but maybe I just need to hang out there more in order to figure it out. Or fall in love with it. Stay tuned.
author: Erin K.

description: I like this place.  Groovy decor, funky, eclectic music on vinyl, (I've never been when the organ player was there), friendly bartenders and lovely cocktails.  Try the Red Margarita.  You'll like it.
author: Veronica J.

description: So pleased to find this place.  Looks like a dive bar from the outside, but other than some tacky/sticky surfaces, it is super sweet, well decorated and a has great drink menu.  And they are playing vinyl!  Definitely stop in for drinks if you are in the hood.
author: M M.

description: This bar is probably my current fav in SF right now. It's fairly new, good vibes, higher end drinks and RECORDS SPINNING! Just pick out what record you wanna here from the card catalog and hand it to the bartender! You must try the homemade-made-from-scratch pomegranate margaritas! They are amazing!!!
author: LaDonna S.

description: I'v been here a few times now- all at different times of the day or night. All were greeted with a friendly bartender (its so rare in the mission). Drinks are not not cheap but they are well crafted and tasty. Last time I was there, there was a guy playing the organ which was rad and the time before, there were guys playing horns again, rad. It's nice to go somewhere that doesn't have a dj or juke box with questionable music. Might be my new favorite.
author: emmie h.

description: Really could be 5 stars, no complaints.  Nice vibe, old school vinyl.  Went there Halloween night, quiet Monday, and they were spinning spooky tunes.  Good beer selection, and reportedly strong mixed drinks.  On Thursday, Friday and Sat. night can be very crowed, but if not, great cozy hang out.
author: Ken H.

description: I really liked this place. I thought the $10 drinks were worth it and not watery at all - this is coming from someone that normally drinks bourbon neat. The B3 was also rocking and I dig the vibe. Definitely a place to go with a smaller crowd of peeps, but a lot of fun for happy hour.
author: Jay N.

description: Fun, totally unique bar.  Yes, it's a little dark.  Yes, there's animals on the walls.  BUT, what other bar has a live organist, actual VINYL playing, and hand crafted cocktails?  None!  This place is a little gem and is a great addition to the neighborhood.
author: Plaid B.

description:
Great drinks, bar service and organ music.  

Only 4 stars because the place is a bit filled with Urban Outfitter hipster wannabees (not that real hipsters are any better), some of whom on our visit during Halloween weekend were dressed in douchey B&T costumes like an American Indian or a white guy dressed as a black woman with a big afro.  The clientele is not really the bar's fault, I mention it only so you know what you are getting into here...  

Still, the comfy chairs and log-cabin vibe make it well worth it.
author: Madeline D.

description: I love just about everything about this place: great music, whether it's live or from the record player, great options for seating whether you're alone, with a bunch of friends or just one special one and a particularly good bartender if you come on the right night.
author: Daniel S.

description: This is a great bar. Somebody was playing the Hammond Organ all night while we sat and had some drinks. I love the Hammond Organ. Dopeness.
author: Jason L.

description: I like this bar for its location and dark, moody decor (cool paintings and taxidermy art). However our drinks were so weak, and that's a dealbreaker ladies. For $5 per drink, the bartender repeatedly poured a 3 to 1 juice to alcohol ratio. I can go to several surrounding places and get more bang for my buck. I want to like this place and Im going to give it another try but I hope they step up on the sauce a bit more
author: Anna S.

description:
Ok.  So if you read a review like some of the ones below and they say "it's too dark" or "I don't drink liquor", then write them off as the loser, bores they are.  

This bar knows how to make a good cocktail (I had several perfect Negronis and also a perfectly served Zambuca with the holy trinity) and the atmosphere is what a great bar is supposed to be: dimly lit with good accent lighting and perfectly appointed interior.  It has a very old-school, casual speakeasy feel.  

If you want a "well-lit" bar with perfectly written menus, then go to the Marina.

The live music was great and the vinyl, DJ'ed music was also.

The crowd was pretty cool and varied.

This bar felt out of time....like when people had manners and taste.
author: Scott L.

description: Worst bartenders ever. Rude, grumpy a**holes. Both of em. Not that they'd care the slightest bit, I won't be back. Thanks for nothing.
author: Chris H.

description: I've been here 3 times, and definitely consider myself a fan at this point.  The Royal Cuckoo has a cozy neighborhood-bar feel, with a funky twist.  Several couches and a few tables and a decent-sized bar that seats about 15 people or so.  The music is supplied by a house organ player.  Most importantly, they have an excellent selection of house cocktails -- the Manhattan is particularly delicious, and the Bitter Cup is a good call if you like Campari (I don't, but my wife loves it).
author: Andrew E.

description: Liked the joint but can't say that it's anything super special.  When I'm in the neighborhood I'll swing by but won't go out of my way to get there.  Drinks were tasty but a bit expensive.  Not bad, not great.
author: Jason L.

description: Slow and solid cocktails with great beers.  The bar staff doesn't smile but I'm not paying for a dim lit  bar's keeper to keep A smile.  Make the trip for a drink, tip em well if you like the drink- they are way fast for making artisian cocktails- and when you tip well, you tend to get better spot in the order, $11 drinks to $5 beer, but I can easily say, the drinks are worth every last drop.  Great place for conversation, vinyl records, and a little cabaret that goes in once a while make for a good time.  A little love in a glass, a lot of good music, and making one of my favorite cocktails in this city makes this 5 stars for me.
author: Devin D.

description:
I really like the attention paid the the decor in this place.  I wish more bars in SF would get into the detail that Royal Cuckoo has pulled off. There is plenty of interesting things to look at in the bar, which is something I really like.  

I'm not sure it's worth coming here from far away, but as someone who lives a few blocks away, I welcome them into our neighborhood.  And I like it more than Bourbon and Branch, which is a little slick and gimmicky for me.

Pros: Great cocktails. Bartenders are nice and responsive. Amazing level of detail on the decor.  It's not too loud and they have a real interesting selection of music they play (all from LPs).  (I look forward to hearing the organ played one of these nights).

Cons: Not a lot of seating, and it's small.  The music is played on a vintage record player, over very bad vintage speakers.  I wish they would at least have some higher-quality vintage speakers; as it is it's a lot of midrange and no treble. (There was no bass in the old days for the most part).  Drinks are about $1-2 more than you would normally expect to pay. 

Petty Complaint: the women's restroom door is right next to one of the seating areas, and the door doesn't close itself. So after someone leaves the bathroom the door tends to swing open, letting the smell of bar bathroom waft over your cocktails.  They just need to install one of those spring things that closes the door after someone leaves it open.

So check it out! You won't be disappointed. It's a great addition to the mid-Mission area (which I refuse to call "La Lengua", heh)

(4 stars instead of 5 because of the price of drinks and the bad sound. But really it should be 4.5 stars)
author: Rusty H.

description:
This is a nice dark and clean bar.   I love the Green Flash on tap.   The service is friendly and attentive.  

Small downside: they sometimes play opera or choir music in the early evening, which may not always be conducive of relaxing after work.
author: workingstiff f.

description:
I don't want to write a review but I promised the bouncer I would. It was my friend's birthday who was visiting from Spain. She took her drink outside when she went to smoke a cigarette, she didn't know that wasn't allowed. The bouncer didn't say anything but when she tried to come back in he got really agitated. He told her she couldn't come back in. She asked if she could get her jacket and he told her no, get the fuck out. So I went to get her jacket and when I came back I told him he could have been polite, seeing being rude doesn't do much to help his bar.
