That's when he got super angry and told me to get the fuck out. I threatened him with a 2 star review on yelp (the drinks weren't terrible), mostly because I knew it would piss him off more. He called me a fucking tourist and said that for every 1 of me 10 more would come. So fuck off, etc. At that point I informed him it would be a 1 star review. He came outside at that point and looked like he wanted to get violent, so I left and he told me "Don't come back." 

The bartender was really rude as well, which was noticed separately by the 10-15 people I had brought to the bar with me. I think we are all banned now.
author: John N.

description: Very chill, yet still lively and neighborhood-y. The drinks are good, and on the night I went there was playing some nice live music. It's closed off from the street, giving a sense of a hidden gem. I highly recommend!
author: Dustin Y.

description: I like the organist and the atmosphere, but my drink was only OK.  I'll come back and try another though...
author: Amjad S.

description: Wowza! It seems like I lucked out compared to others experiences. I thought it was a gem. A dark, cool attic atmosphere-like gem with interesting drinks and great records playing.
author: Cat S.

description: I was excited to stumble on this bar after a delicious dinner at Blue Plate - I am always looking for and trying new spots in SF.  The name was interesting, the atmosphere seemed inviting and it looked to be the perfect place to enjoy an after-dinner drink.  We ordered two seemingly interesting cocktails from the menu - I do love the different ingredients and flavors that bartenders create drinks with and I do have an adventurious palate.  Both drinks, however,  were undrinkable - overpowering and unbalanced flavors, not at all enjoyable (even after giving the drink a couple of sips).  I rarely ask for a replacement when at restaurants/bars, but when I do (as all customers should if they are unsatisfied), I do expect to be accomodated.  Not only was my request denied, I was told that we were the only ones that had ever disliked their drinks and that the drinks were too expensive to replace (really?).  The woman and her cohort behind the bar were both rude and I sat down for a couple more minutes and left pretty annoyed.  I vowed to write this review and let others know that if you were looking for any sort of enjoyable experience, don't visit this bar - it'll ruin your night.  I found it interesting that I am not alone in having had a negative experience.  Good luck, Royal Cuckoo - you might want to reconsider how your 'mixology' and how you treat your guests if you want to make it in this city.  Word travels fast...
author: Sarah P.

description: Great little addition to the nabe. Stunning vintage bar, comfy mood lighting, nice beers on tap and doggies welcome. Proper glassware (chimay glasses). Bartender was super attentive, quick to refill beers and offering the pups some water.
author: Beth M.

description:
meh. me no likey.
nothing special, and i wasn't into the bartenders attitude.
i always think, you gotta have one of the 2 going for you: either great drinks/ambience/music or great service.
this place has neither.
author: Emliy H.

description: Let's see--horrible seating, even for a group of 4. Can't possibly sit face to face even though that could have been an option in their furnishing/design.  Watered down drinks not worth the very hefty price.  VERY long wait time for said watered down drinks.  Drink orders taken out of turn.  Then the Hammond organ.  That's fine, but don't come asking me for a tip because you "don't charge cover."  That is plain desperation.  This place is in my neighborhood.  Believe me, I would LOVE to like this place.  But it's just plain uncomfortable, expensive, and entitled.
author: Kathy R.

description: had their version of a 'Manhattan' and it's the first time I've been to a bar, ordered a drink, and wanted to ask for a refund...how can you mess up a classic cocktail?
author: Reg R.

description: can the guy that took that video of me freestyling a karaoke song i didn't know please send me the video?   thanks!  fun times at the royal cuckoo!!
author: Indianna H.

description: a cozy spot to grab a drink, be with good company and listen to fine tunes. hats off to the bartenders. seems like a good bunch
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Stopped by the new Royal Cuckoo bar on a Friday night after leaving El Rio. What a great addition to the Bernal-Mission strip! I like the decor- very hunting lodge meets hipster bar, and they have a good selection of beers, wine and cocktails. I like the plentiful seating too. I don't know how the Royal Cuckoo will fare after multiple visits, but I will say I'm very excited about this bar. It deserves four stars for a strong start!
author: Kika S.

description: We found it charming as hell.  I loved the darkness and the twinkly lite placement around the bar.stopped in for Manhattons before  dining at The Blue Plate.RETURN VISIT FOR SURE.
author: Carol B.

description: There for the first time tonight, and I found it really pleasant. Our group of five was able to chat (the background music was at a very reasonable level), and those of us who had cocktails all really enjoyed them. I'm delighted to find a quiet bar so close to my new apartment.
author: Rose W.

description: Count my vote as 3 1/2 stars. Went here with a friend. A live jazz band was playing which was nice, however, after they stopped some weird tribal music came on. Drinks were decently priced (for the city) and the cocktail menu was quite unique. Both cocktails I tried were really great. Seating was not so good, but around 10:30 a lot of them were free.
author: Whitney G.

description: My friend and I stumbled upon the Royal Cuckoo on a rainy Saturday afternoon which after a handful of Danish Daisies later, turned into a Saturday night.  The bar is cozy, prices are about right (about $8 for speciality cocktails) and the bartenders are great.  The bartender that we had for several hours was funny, friendly and most importantly an excellent mixologist.  It was all worth the severe pounding headache the next day.
author: K V.

description: Super cool bar. Love that they spin records and have a guy that comes in and plays the b3 organ! Great drinks in a cool atmoshpere. It is really freakin dark inside though. Maybe that's why evryone looked so attractive? It was probably that and the five bourbans we had there. Whatever it was fun..
author: mark h.

description: some of the best drinks I've had in a while - not as good as Nihon, Bourbon and Branch, Rye, or the Alembic, but better than most other bars in the city.
author: Fred A.

description: Great atmosphere, dim lights and very comforting, the special cocktails are fabulous. Their well drinks are almost top shelf and only $5, Plus great music.
author: Sebastian J.

description:
one star for strong drinks.
one star for being one block from my house.
one star for the friendly door man.
zero stars for customer service.

went there yesterday for the first time.
everything was great until my girlfriend went over to the bar to check out the record that was playing, and even though she was many feet away from it; it happened to skip right then. bartender completely flips out on her, then the other one accuses her of touching it. (really, dude, you saw her walking behind the bar, touching the record player?) she's truly sorry, even offering to pay for it, and they're just not having it and getting security and kicking us out. 
(really? security for 4 girls?) we had 2 drinks, weren't drunk, weren't out of control. i believe there was no reason to get 86'd. (i mean, come on, even if you think we should move on, then ASK us nicely to leave)
so, bottom line is:
the 2 dudes behind the bar have absolutely no communication skills! (or to be more clear, they don't let you talk)
i bartended for many years and own a business a block away and know about customer service skills and how important they are.
i really wanna give them 2 stars for being such jerks, but i hate being the spoiler.
i won't be back.
author: anett r.
